title: Ticket #5549: Job Router Daemon not publishing self-monitoring ads
description:
The Job_Router ad is quite sparse at the moment, it would be great to see more ads in here, especially for monitoring purposes.

As the job router becomes more and more critical in some of the bigger condor deployments. 

~]# condor_status -any -pool red-gw1.unl.edu:9619 jobrouter-ce@red-gw1.unl.edu -l | sort

AddressV1 = "{[ p=\"primary\"; a=\"129.93.239.132\"; port=9619; n=\"Internet\"; spid=\"2385_1e46_4\"; noUDP=true; ], [ p=\"IPv4\"; a=\"129.93.239.132\"; port=9619; n=\"Internet\"; spid=\"2385_1e46_4\"; noUDP=true; ]}"

RecentDaemonCoreDutyCycle may not make much sense here, much like the Negotiator.

However it would be nice if it recorded stats from the routing periods such as total routing time, number successful/failed and the throttle rate.

Similar to the negotiation stats from the Negotiator ad.
